Description: Tent hanging with a heavy cotton backing. Geometric and floral designs as well as phrases in Arabic appliquéd to the base cloth in red, light and dark blue and white cotton cloth.
Curator's comments: Illustrated by Picton & Mack, 1989, p.181 with the caption 'Cotton text hanging with applied embellishments of Islamic inspiration in blue, red, white and black. Egypt.'
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Captain Tristram C S Speedy
Acquisition notes: Collected by Capt.T.C.Speedy, the interpreter of the British Expedition to Abyssinia in 1867-68; perhaps bought in Egypt while en route.
